dict.string:
With the Restore code, you can restore a previous version of the Battle.net Authenticator app. This will be helpful if:
• You get a new phone • Your current phone requires a factory reset
Cloud Sync backs up your authenticator on your #$iCloud Keychain#$, making setup and recovery easy if you switch to a new device. To turn this feature on, you will need to enable the iCloud Keychain.
How can I safely detach my authenticator?
1. Vist #$battle.net/bma#$ 2. Follow the instructions provided on the site.
Locked yourself out of your Battle.net Account?

1. If you have the restore code and serial number, you can restore the previous version of your authenticator and use it to log in.
2. If you have SMS Protect set up, you can visit the Account Recovery page, enter your registered email address, and select the option to "use SMS Protect" to unlock your account.

If you need more help with your Battle.net Mobile Authenticator, please contact Blizzard Entertainment customer support:
• Americas, Europe, Korea, Taiwan: #$https://battle.net/support/#$ • China: #$https://www.battlenet.com.cn/support/#$
